results.title: Southwest of Salem: The Story of the San Antonio Four
results.brief_description: In 1994, four women were accused, tried, and convicted of the heinous sexual assault of two young girls—as one newscaster puts it, “the modern version of the witchcraft trials.” Twenty years later, the four women have maintained their innocence, insisting that the accusations were entirely fabricated, and borne of homophobic prejudice and a late-’90s mania about covens, cults, and child abuse.

constellations_other.name: Presumption of guilt
constellations_other.description: A Constellation looking at true crime documentaries, the nature of innocence and prejudice.

results.title_for_label: Southwest of Salem: The Story of the San Antonio Four
results.description: In 1994, four women were accused, tried, and convicted of the heinous sexual assault of two young girls—as one newscaster puts it, “the modern version of the witchcraft trials.” Twenty years later, the four women have maintained their innocence, insisting that the accusations were entirely fabricated, and borne of homophobic prejudice and a late-’90s mania about covens, cults, and child abuse.

results.title: Some Like It Hot
results.creator_credit: United Artists, Orry-Kelly and Michael Logan
results.brief_description: Two musicians witness a mob hit and struggle to find a way out of the city before they are found by the gangsters. Their only opportunity is to join an all-girl band as they leave on a tour.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

results.description: Two musicians witness a mob hit and struggle to find a way out of the city before they are found by the gangsters. Their only opportunity is to join an all-girl band as they leave on a tour. To make their getaway they must first disguise themselves as women, then keep their identities secret and deal with the problems this brings - such as an attractive bandmate and a very determined suitor.
description_for_label: Two musicians witness a mob hit and struggle to find a way out of the city before they are found by the gangsters. Their only opportunity is to join an all-girl band as they leave on a tour. To make their getaway they must first disguise themselves as women, then keep their identities secret and deal with the problems this brings - such as an attractive bandmate and a very determined suitor.

results.title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Merrill De Maris, Dorothy Ann Blank, Webb Smith, Bob Broughton, Walt Disney, David Hand, Ted Sears, Richard Creedon, Otto Englander, Dick Rickard, Earl Hurd and Virginia Lockwood
results.brief_description: Snow White, takes refuge in the forest in the house of seven dwarfs to hide from her stepmother, the wicked Queen. The Queen is jealous because she wants to be “the fairest in the land,” and Snow White’s beauty surpasses her own.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Productions, Merrill De Maris, Dorothy Ann Blank, Webb Smith, Bob Broughton, Walt Disney, David Hand, Ted Sears, Richard Creedon, Otto Englander, Dick Rickard, Earl Hurd and Virginia Lockwood
results.description: A beautiful girl, Snow White, takes refuge in the forest in the house of seven dwarfs to hide from her stepmother, the wicked Queen. The Queen is jealous because she wants to be known as “the fairest in the land,” and Snow White’s beauty surpasses her own.
description_for_label: A beautiful girl, Snow White, takes refuge in the forest in the house of seven dwarfs to hide from her stepmother, the wicked Queen. The Queen is jealous because she wants to be known as “the fairest in the land,” and Snow White’s beauty surpasses her own.

results.title: Sleeper Cell
results.brief_description: A chilling and unflinching look at all sides of a complicated issue, focusing on an African-American Muslim who joins an Islamic sleeper terrorist cell in the United States while working undercover for the FBI.
results.description: A chilling and unflinching look at all sides of a complicated issue, focusing on an African-American Muslim who joins an Islamic sleeper terrorist cell in the United States while working undercover for the FBI.
description_for_label: A chilling and unflinching look at all sides of a complicated issue, focusing on an African-American Muslim who joins an Islamic sleeper terrorist cell in the United States while working undercover for the FBI.

results.title: Skate Kitchen
results.creator_credit: Bow + Arrow Entertainment, Pulse Films, RT Features, Crystal Moselle, Matthew Perniciaro, Rodrigo Teixeira, Fletcher Chancey, Julia Nottingham, Michael Sherman, Aslihan Ünaldı, Jen Silverman, Camille Garmendia, Izabella Tzenkova and Lizzie Nastro
results.brief_description: Camille’s life as a lonely suburban teenager changes dramatically when she befriends a group of girl skateboarders. As she journeys deeper into this raw New York City subculture, she begins to understand the true meaning of friendship as well as her inner self.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bow + Arrow Entertainment, Pulse Films, RT Features, Crystal Moselle, Matthew Perniciaro, Rodrigo Teixeira, Fletcher Chancey, Julia Nottingham, Michael Sherman, Aslihan Ünaldı, Jen Silverman, Camille Garmendia, Izabella Tzenkova and Lizzie Nastro
results.description: Camille’s life as a lonely suburban teenager changes dramatically when she befriends a group of girl skateboarders. As she journeys deeper into this raw New York City subculture, she begins to understand the true meaning of friendship as well as her inner self.

video_links.name: Skate Kitchen Official Trailer - Starring The Skate Kitchen and Jaden Smith

results.title: Silvered Water
results.creator_credit: Proaction Film, Les Films d'ici, Ossama Mohammed and Wiam Bedirxan
results.headline_credit: France, Lebanon, Syrian Arab Republic and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: Shot by a reported “1,001 Syrians” according to the filmmakers, Silvered Water impressionistically documents the destruction and atrocities of the civil war through a combination of eye-witness accounts shot on mobile phones and posted to the internet, and footage shot by Bedirxan during the siege of Homs.

constellations_other.name: Cities under siege
constellations_other.description: The Syrian Civil War is an ongoing conflict that is arguably the most documented in history, with images and videos captured by journalists, activists, combatants and victims.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Proaction Film, Les Films d’ici, Ossama Mohammed and Wiam Bedirxan
results.headline_credit_for_label: France, Lebanon, Syrian Arab Republic and United States of America, 2014
results.description: Shot by a reported “1,001 Syrians” according to the filmmakers, SILVERED WATER, SYRIA SELF-PORTRAIT impressionistically documents the destruction and atrocities of the civil war through a combination of eye-witness accounts shot on mobile phones and posted to the internet, and footage shot by Bedirxan during the siege of Homs. Bedirxan, an elementary school teacher in Homs, had contacted Mohammed online to ask him what he would film, if he was there. Mohammed, working in forced exile in Paris, is tormented by feelings of cowardice as he witnesses the horrors from afar, and the self-reflexive film also chronicles how he is haunted in his dreams by a Syrian boy once shot to death for snatching his camera on the street.
description_for_label: Shot by a reported “1,001 Syrians” according to the filmmakers, SILVERED WATER, SYRIA SELF-PORTRAIT impressionistically documents the destruction and atrocities of the civil war through a combination of eye-witness accounts shot on mobile phones and posted to the internet, and footage shot by Bedirxan during the siege of Homs. Bedirxan, an elementary school teacher in Homs, had contacted Mohammed online to ask him what he would film, if he was there. Mohammed, working in forced exile in Paris, is tormented by feelings of cowardice as he witnesses the horrors from afar, and the self-reflexive film also chronicles how he is haunted in his dreams by a Syrian boy once shot to death for snatching his camera on the street.

results.title: Shirley Temple Story
results.brief_description: A humorously distorted version of the life of Shirley Temple, and described by its director as a terrorist musical. Shirley Temple sets off for the Emerald City to tell the Wizard that she is upset that Judy Garland has been selected for the role of Dorothy in The Wizard of Oz. On this trip she is accompanied by a group of characters who make reference to a fragmented, bipolar society. The film was begun as Franco was ill and completed after his death, and makes reference to the oppression of Spain during this period.
results.description: A humorously distorted version of the life of Shirley Temple, and described by its director as a terrorist musical. results.title: She Who Must Be Loved
results.creator_credit: Erica Glynn, Since 1788 Productions, ADL Film Fest Fund and Tanith Glynn-Maloney
results.brief_description: A documentary that tells the epic life story of Alfreda Glynn, 78-year-old Aboriginal woman, stills photographer, co-founder of the Central Australian Aboriginal Media Association (CAAMA), and Imparja TV.

constellations_other.name: Connecting through film
constellations_other.description: Film acts like a time capsule to our collective past. Capturing our most treasured moments with family has never been more accessible, with technology right at our fingers.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Erica Glynn, Since 1788 Productions, ADL Film Fest Fund and Tanith Glynn-Maloney
results.description: A documentary that tells the epic life story of Alfreda Glynn, 78-year-old Aboriginal woman, stills photographer, co-founder of the Central Australian Aboriginal Media Association (CAAMA), and Imparja TV, mother, grandmother, great grandmother, radical, pacifist, grumpy old woman, who in equal measure loves the limelight and total privacy. Part bio-pic, part social history, it details the life of a woman born beneath a tree north of Alice Springs in 1939, her childhood living under the Aboriginal Protection policies and the impact, both good and bad they had on her life.
description_for_label: A documentary that tells the epic life story of Alfreda Glynn, 78-year-old Aboriginal woman, stills photographer, co-founder of the Central Australian Aboriginal Media Association (CAAMA), and Imparja TV, mother, grandmother, great grandmother, radical, pacifist, grumpy old woman, who in equal measure loves the limelight and total privacy. Part bio-pic, part social history, it details the life of a woman born beneath a tree north of Alice Springs in 1939, her childhood living under the Aboriginal Protection policies and the impact, both good and bad they had on her life.

results.title: She's Out
results.brief_description: Dolly Rawlins is free again. She has served the eight year prison sentence for her husband’s murder and is now set to collect the six million pounds worth of diamonds that she stashed before she was sent down. The money will enable her to follow her dreams and start a new life. But her former cell mates have their own ideas…

constellations_other.name: Women, crime and literature
constellations_other.description: Judy & Punch draws on a classic puppet show that's been reframed by director Mirrah Foulkes as a feminist tale, much like the works that put women at the centre in this Constellation.

results.description: Dolly Rawlins is free again. She has served the eight year prison sentence for her husband’s murder and is now set to collect the six million pounds worth of diamonds that she stashed before she was sent down. The money will enable her to follow her dreams and start a new life. But her former cell mates have their own ideas…

results.title: Shattered Glass
results.creator_credit: Cruise/Wagner Productions, Baumgarten Merims Productions, Forest Park Pictures, Renée April, Craig Baumgarten, Billy Ray, Adam Merims, François Séguin, Gaye Hirsch, Buzz Bissinger and Tove Christensen
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2003
results.brief_description: The true story of fraudulent Washington, D.C. journalist Stephen Glass, who rose to meteoric heights as a young writer in his 20s, becoming a staff writer at The New Republic for three years. Looking for a short cut to fame, Glass concocted sources, quotes and even entire stories, but his deception did not go unnoticed forever, and eventually, his world came crumbling down.

constellations_other.name: Uncovering the truth
constellations_other.description: The images of Tank Man during the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989 were captured by photojournalists and shared around the world. The work of journalists has been key to uncovering abuses of power and are rich material for fictional and factual movies and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Cruise/Wagner Productions, Baumgarten Merims Productions, Forest Park Pictures, Renée April, Craig Baumgarten, Billy Ray, Adam Merims, François Séguin, Gaye Hirsch, Buzz Bissinger and Tove Christensen
results.description: The true story of fraudulent Washington, D.C. journalist Stephen Glass, who rose to meteoric heights as a young writer in his 20s, becoming a staff writer at The New Republic for three years. Looking for a short cut to fame, Glass concocted sources, quotes and even entire stories, but his deception did not go unnoticed forever, and eventually, his world came crumbling down.
